alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued April 21 at 11:59AM EDT until April 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Gulf and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The high risk in Gulf County applies to South-Cape/Indian Pass, while the State Park and North Cape are under a moderate risk where morning flags are yellow from more offshore flow. The pattern is favorable for frequent rip currents through the weekend as strong east to southeast winds prevail over the next few days.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
